availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Beriah Magoffin: Governor's Official Correspondence File, Petitions for Pardons and Remissions, 1859-1862

body.p:
Decbr 26 1860 --
To his Exelancy B Mcgofin Exeuctive of the Commonwelth of kentucky

we the undersigned your petitioners so Respectfully Represent ourselves to your Exelancy that on the 10th day of September 1860 there was apprehended and Brought before wm T Spencer justis of the peace for wolf County a certain delingham kid James taulby and John Sparks all citizons of wolf county on a charg of a breach of the peace together with the Said charge the Jury fined for the commonwealth against James taulby $5.. also they fine John Sparks $2.50 ^cts^ and fineed dilingham kid $5 00 also the Virdic of the Same Jury Said that your petisioner kid pay all the Cost for which the virdict of the Jury Extrecated the other 2 defendants of paying of any of the cost of the above complained Virdict they also would not allow your humble petisioner kid the alternitive of going to Jail to pay his fine your petitioners do Respectfullly and humbly ask your -- Exelency to Remit the fine of your -- humble applicant delingham kid you humble petitioner is a Very pour man and hard run to keep his five orphant children from suffering as the high hand of Deity has takened his Bosom friend from the Embrace of his arms and this do Everly pray

Issd Jany 15. 1861
